meanings.sent1: The nonnoble family lived in a small house.
meanings.sent2: She preferred the nonnoble simplicity of her upbringing.
meanings.sent3: The nonnoble cat thought it was a king, wearing a paper crown.
meanings.sent4: The nonnoble flower stood proudly among the roses.
meanings.sent5: The nonnoble attire of the villagers contrasted with the regal robes of the king.

meanings.definition: Lacking the qualities or characteristics of nobility.
meanings.sent1: His nonnoble behavior at the party shocked everyone.
meanings.sent2: The nonnoble manners of the guest offended the host.
meanings.sent3: The nonnoble squirrel tried to steal the fancy nuts from the noble squirrel.
meanings.sent4: Her nonnoble speech was a stark contrast to the eloquence of the queen.
meanings.sent5: The nonnoble building stood out in the elegant neighborhood like a sore thumb.
